column4: A funny question: Can I access my files from Windows XP in any way?
I mean the other way.
If I'm in Windows XP and want to listen to my newly downloaded songs.
Hello.
I have noticed this strange bug in my boot manager.
Every time I boot, there is one more instance of Ubuntu in the boot list.
It says both normal- and rescue mode.
that is by design..
why should it be very bug?
so, u have installed a number of various kernels?
odd... never seen that before.. u r using grub or lilo?
I'd recommend u to create a bug report for that one...
sorry, but I have no idea what that would happen, it shouldn't...
can u check if u have a lot of entries in /boot/grub/menu.lst?
in that file grub specifies what choises u have when booting u c...
do u also have the corresponding kernels in /boot?
they could have been, I just installed ubuntu the other day myself, so am not sure, but the possibility is there..
yes, but by using apt or synaptic to do so, just to do it cleanly..
*-386 is the bog standard kernel, whereas *-686 is optimised for PentiumII and up processors...
Ah, u'd still have gains, but best gains then is to use a *-k7 kernel...
that should take care of those headaches for you...
yes..
no probbs..
does it fail loading hw_random.ko or something like that?
